name: EveryEarthquake
description: Get every earthquake and any other event that registers on the richter scale ever catalogued by the USGS, with very detailed location data.

api_methods.name: Recent Earthquakes
api_methods.description: Get the 100 most recent earthquakes from all over in the world, from now to the date and time determined by the 'interval' property.

parameters.name: interval
parameters.description: Get recent earthquakes from current time, back to a time based on the interval provided. Interval is an ISO8601 Duration, examples: P5D for the last 5 days, PT12H for the last 12 hours. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Durations

parameters.name: count
parameters.description:
Add to any call to limit the number of earthquakes returned.
100 earthquakes are returned by default, up to 1000 earthquakes can be returned using the 'count' parameter.

parameters.name: radius
parameters.description:
The length across half a circle of the search area. The latitude and longitude together make up the center of the circle, while the radius is the distance from the center to the outside of the circle. A 10 mile radius will be a circle 20 miles across with its center at the latitude/longitude point.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

constraints.inter-dependency: latitude, longitude, radius, units: All four parameters must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

parameters.name: units
parameters.description:
Either miles or kilometers for the radius of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

constraints.inter-dependency: latitude, longitude, radius, units: All four parameters must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

parameters.name: intensity
parameters.description: Intensity can be added to limit results to only those earthquakes with at least the specified intensity or greater.

parameters.name: magnitude
parameters.description: Magnitude can be added to limit results to only those earthquakes with at least the specified magnitude or greater.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description:
The longitude portion of the point at the center of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

constraints.inter-dependency: latitude, longitude, radius, units: All four parameters must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description:
Use the 'start' parameter to retrieve more than 1000 earthquakes, up to 1000 at a time. 'Start' is the offset to start at within the overall results.
100 earthquakes are returned by default, up to 1000 earthquakes can be returned using the 'count' parameter.

parameters.name: latitude
parameters.description:
The latitude portion of the point at the center of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

constraints.inter-dependency: latitude, longitude, radius, units: All four parameters must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type can be added to limit results to only those types specified, e.g.: earthquakes, quarry blasts, explosions. Use the 'types' endpoints to see all available types.

api_methods.name: API Test
api_methods.description: Simple call to determine if the API is available and responding.

api_methods.name: Earthquakes By Date
api_methods.description: Get the 100 most recent earthquakes from all over in the world, within a specified date range.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The start date for the search period in YYYY-MM-DD format. All dates start and end at midnight UTC.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: The end date for the search period in YYYY-MM-DD format. All dates start and end at midnight UTC.

parameters.name: intensity
parameters.description: Intensity can be added to limit results to only those earthquakes with at least the specified intensity or greater.

parameters.name: longitude
parameters.description:
The longitude portion of the point at the center of the search circle.
Search for earthquakes near a certain location using latitude, longitude, radius and units. All four properties must be included when retrieving earthquakes near a certain location.

api_methods.name: Types
api_methods.description: Return all types of events ever recorded by the USGS, such as earthquakes, explosions, landslides and many more.

api_methods.name: Earthquakes
api_methods.description: Get the 100 most recent earthquakes from all over in the world. No parameters required.

api_methods.name: Latest Earthquake Near Me
api_methods.description: Call this endpoint with your latitude and longitude and you'll receive a simple return for the most recent earthquake, within 100 miles, of the lat/long coordinates provided.
